074/**
075 * Provides a socket server. The server binds to the given address. If the
076 * address is {@code null}, address and port are automatically assigned.
077 * The port may be overwritten by a configuration event
078 * (see {@link #onConfigurationUpdate(ConfigurationUpdate)}).
079 * 
080 * For each established connection, the server creates a new
081 * {@link LinkedIOSubchannel}. The servers basic operation is to
082 * fire {@link Input} (and {@link Closed}) events on the
083 * appropriate subchannel in response to data received from the
084 * network and to handle {@link Output} (and {@link Close}) events 
085 * on the subchannel and forward the information to the network
086 * connection.
087 * 
088 * The server supports limiting the number of concurrent connections
089 * with a {@link PermitsPool}. If such a pool is set as connection
090 * limiter (see {@link #setConnectionLimiter(PermitsPool)}), a
091 * permit is acquired for each new connection attempt. If no more
092 * permits are available, the server sends a {@link Purge} event on
093 * each channel that is purgeable for at least the time span
094 * set with {@link #setMinimalPurgeableTime(long)}. Purgeability 
095 * is derived from the end of record flag of {@link Output} events
096 * (see {@link #onOutput(Output, SocketChannelImpl)}. When using this feature, 
097 * make sure that connections are either short lived or the application
098 * level components support the {@link Purge} event. Else, it may become
099 * impossible to establish new connections.
100 */
101@SuppressWarnings({ "PMD.ExcessiveImports", "PMD.ExcessivePublicCount",
102    "PMD.NcssCount", "PMD.EmptyCatchBlock", "PMD.AvoidDuplicateLiterals",
103    "PMD.ExcessiveClassLength" })
104public class SocketServer extends SocketConnectionManager
105        implements NioHandler {
106
107    private SocketAddress serverAddress;
108    private ServerSocketChannel serverSocketChannel;
109    private boolean closing;
110    private int backlog;
111    private PermitsPool connLimiter;
112    private Registration registration;
113    private Purger purger;
114    private long minimumPurgeableTime;
115
116    /**
117     * The purger thread.
118     */
119    private class Purger extends Thread implements AvailabilityListener {
120
121        private boolean permitsAvailable = true;
122
123        /**
124         * Instantiates a new purger.
125         */
126        public Purger() {
127            setName(Components.simpleObjectName(this));
128            setDaemon(true);
129        }
130
131        @Override
132        public void availabilityChanged(PermitsPool pool, boolean available) {
133            if (registration == null) {
134                return;
135            }
136            synchronized (this) {
137                permitsAvailable = available;
138                registration.updateInterested(
139                    permitsAvailable ? SelectionKey.OP_ACCEPT : 0);
140                if (!permitsAvailable) {
141                    this.notifyAll();
142                }
143            }
144        }
145
146        @Override
147        @SuppressWarnings({ "PMD.AvoidInstantiatingObjectsInLoops",
148            "PMD.DataflowAnomalyAnalysis", "PMD.CognitiveComplexity" })
149        public void run() {
150            if (connLimiter == null) {
151                return;
152            }
153            try {
154                connLimiter.addListener(this);
155                while (serverSocketChannel.isOpen()) {
156                    synchronized (this) {
157                        while (permitsAvailable) {
158                            wait();
159                        }
160                    }
161                    // Copy to avoid ConcurrentModificationException
162                    List<SocketChannelImpl> candidates;
163                    synchronized (channels) {
164                        candidates = new ArrayList<>(channels);
165                    }
166                    long purgeableSince
167                        = System.currentTimeMillis() - minimumPurgeableTime;
168                    candidates = candidates.stream()
169                        .filter(channel -> channel.isPurgeable()
170                            && channel.purgeableSince() < purgeableSince)
171                        .sorted(new Comparator<SocketChannelImpl>() {
172                            @Override
173                            @SuppressWarnings("PMD.ShortVariable")
174                            public int compare(SocketChannelImpl c1,
175                                    SocketChannelImpl c2) {
176                                if (c1.purgeableSince() < c2
177                                    .purgeableSince()) {
178                                    return 1;
179                                }
180                                if (c1.purgeableSince() > c2
181                                    .purgeableSince()) {
182                                    return -1;
183                                }
184                                return 0;
185                            }
186                        })
187                        .collect(Collectors.toList());
188                    for (SocketChannelImpl channel : candidates) {
189                        // Sorting may have taken time...
190                        if (!channel.isPurgeable()) {
191                            continue;
192                        }
193                        channel.downPipeline().fire(new Purge(), channel);
194                        // Continue only as long as necessary
195                        if (permitsAvailable) {
196                            break;
197                        }
198                    }
199                    sleep(1000);
200                }
201            } catch (InterruptedException e) {
202                // Fall through
203            } finally {
204                connLimiter.removeListener(this);
205            }
206        }
207
208    }
209

244    /**
245     * The component can be configured with events that include
246     * a path (see @link {@link ConfigurationUpdate#paths()})
247     * that matches this components path (see {@link Manager#componentPath()}).
248     * 
249     * The following properties are recognized:
250     * 
251     * `hostname`
252     * : If given, is used as first parameter for 
253     *   {@link InetSocketAddress#InetSocketAddress(String, int)}.
254     * 
255     * `port`
256     * : If given, is used as parameter for 
257     *   {@link InetSocketAddress#InetSocketAddress(String, int)} 
258     *   or {@link InetSocketAddress#InetSocketAddress(int)}, 
259     *   depending on whether a host name is specified. Defaults to "0".
260     *   
261     * `backlog`
262     * : See {@link #setBacklog(int)}.
263     * 
264     * `bufferSize`
265     * : See {@link #setBufferSize(int)}.
266     * 
267     * `maxConnections`
268     * : Calls {@link #setConnectionLimiter} with a
269     *   {@link PermitsPool} of the specified size.
270     * 
271     * `minimalPurgeableTime`
272     * : See {@link #setMinimalPurgeableTime(long)}.
273     * 
274     * @param event the event
275     */
276    @Handler
277    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.ConfusingTernary")
278    public void onConfigurationUpdate(ConfigurationUpdate event) {
279        event.values(componentPath()).ifPresent(values -> {
280            String hostname = values.get("hostname");
281            if (hostname != null) {
282                setServerAddress(new InetSocketAddress(hostname,
283                    Integer.parseInt(values.getOrDefault("port", "0"))));
284            } else if (values.containsKey("port")) {
285                setServerAddress(new InetSocketAddress(
286                    Integer.parseInt(values.get("port"))));
287            }
288            Optional.ofNullable(values.get("backlog")).ifPresent(
289                value -> setBacklog(Integer.parseInt(value)));
290            Optional.ofNullable(values.get("bufferSize")).ifPresent(
291                value -> setBufferSize(Integer.parseInt(value)));
292            Optional.ofNullable(values.get("maxConnections"))
293                .map(Integer::parseInt).map(PermitsPool::new)
294                .ifPresent(this::setConnectionLimiter);
295            Optional.ofNullable(values.get("minimalPurgeableTime"))
296                .map(Long::parseLong).ifPresent(this::setMinimalPurgeableTime);
297        });
298    }
299
300    /**
301     * Returns the server address. Before starting, the address is the
302     * address set with {@link #setServerAddress(InetSocketAddress)}. After
303     * starting the address is obtained from the created socket.  
304     * 
305     * @return the serverAddress
306     */
307    public SocketAddress serverAddress() {
308        try {
309            return serverSocketChannel == null ? serverAddress
310                : serverSocketChannel.getLocalAddress();
311        } catch (IOException e) {
312            return serverAddress;
313        }
314    }

380    /**
381     * Starts the server.
382     * 
383     * @param event the start event
384     * @throws IOException if an I/O exception occurred
385     */
386    @Handler
387    public void onStart(Start event) throws IOException {
388        closing = false;
389        serverSocketChannel = ServerSocketChannel.open();
390        serverSocketChannel.bind(serverAddress, backlog);
391        MBeanView.addServer(this);
392        fire(new NioRegistration(this, serverSocketChannel,
393            SelectionKey.OP_ACCEPT, this), Channel.BROADCAST);
394    }
395
396    /**
397     * Handles the successful channel registration.
398     *
399     * @param event the event
400     * @throws InterruptedException the interrupted exception
401     * @throws IOException Signals that an I/O exception has occurred.
402     */
403    @Handler(channels = Self.class)
404    public void onRegistered(NioRegistration.Completed event)
405            throws InterruptedException, IOException {
406        NioHandler handler = event.event().handler();
407        if (handler == this) {
408            if (event.event().get() == null) {
409                fire(new Error(event,
410                    "Registration failed, no NioDispatcher?"));
411                return;
412            }
413            registration = event.event().get();
414            purger = new Purger();
415            purger.start();
416            fire(new Ready(serverSocketChannel.getLocalAddress()));
417            return;
418        }
419        if (handler instanceof SocketChannelImpl) {
420            SocketChannelImpl channel = (SocketChannelImpl) handler;
421            var accepted = new Accepted(channel.nioChannel().getLocalAddress(),
422                channel.nioChannel().getRemoteAddress(), false,
423                Collections.emptyList());
424            var registration = event.event().get();
425            // (1) Opening, (2) Accepted, (3) process input
426            channel.downPipeline().fire(Event.onCompletion(new Opening<Void>(),
427                e -> {
428                    channel.downPipeline().fire(accepted, channel);
429                    channel.registrationComplete(registration);
430                }), channel);
431        }
432    }
433
434    /*
435     * (non-Javadoc)
436     * 
437     * @see org.jgrapes.io.NioSelectable#handleOps(int)
438     */
439    @Override
440    public void handleOps(int ops) {
441        if ((ops & SelectionKey.OP_ACCEPT) == 0 || closing) {
442            return;
443        }
444        synchronized (channels) {
445            if (connLimiter != null && !connLimiter.tryAcquire()) {
446                return;
447            }
448            try {
449                @SuppressWarnings("PMD.CloseResource")
450                SocketChannel socketChannel = serverSocketChannel.accept();
451                if (socketChannel == null) {
452                    // "False alarm"
453                    if (connLimiter != null) {
454                        connLimiter.release();
455                    }
456                    return;
457                }
458                channels.add(new SocketChannelImpl(null, socketChannel));
459            } catch (IOException e) {
460                fire(new IOError(null, e));
461            }
462        }
463    }
464
465    @Override
466    protected boolean removeChannel(SocketChannelImpl channel) {
467        synchronized (channels) {
468            if (!channels.remove(channel)) {
469                // Closed already
470                return false;
471            }
472            // In case the server is shutting down
473            channels.notifyAll();
474        }
475        if (connLimiter != null) {
476            connLimiter.release();
477        }
478        return true;
479    }
480
481    /**
482     * Shuts down the server or one of the connections to the server.
483     *
484     * @param event the event
485     * @throws IOException if an I/O exception occurred
486     * @throws InterruptedException if the execution was interrupted
487     */
488    @Handler
489    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.DataflowAnomalyAnalysis")
490    public void onClose(Close event) throws IOException, InterruptedException {
491        boolean closeServer = false;
492        for (Channel channel : event.channels()) {
493            if (channels.contains(channel)) {
494                ((SocketChannelImpl) channel).close();
495                continue;
496            }
497            if (channel instanceof Subchannel) {
498                // Some subchannel that we're not interested in.
499                continue;
500            }
501            // Close event on "main" channel
502            closeServer = true;
503        }
504        if (!closeServer) {
505            // Only connection(s) were to be closed.
506            return;
507        }
508        if (!serverSocketChannel.isOpen()) {
509            // Closed already
510            fire(new Closed<Void>());
511            return;
512        }
513        synchronized (channels) {
514            closing = true;
515            // Copy to avoid concurrent modification exception
516            Set<SocketChannelImpl> conns = new HashSet<>(channels);
517            for (SocketChannelImpl conn : conns) {
518                conn.close();
519            }
520            while (!channels.isEmpty()) {
521                channels.wait();
522            }
523        }
524        serverSocketChannel.close();
525        purger.interrupt();
526        closing = false;
527        fire(new Closed<Void>());
528    }
529
530    /**
531     * Shuts down the server by firing a {@link Close} using the
532     * server as channel. Note that this automatically results
533     * in closing all open connections by the runtime system
534     * and thus in {@link Closed} events on all subchannels.
535     * 
536     * @param event the event
537     * @throws InterruptedException 
538     */
539    @Handler(priority = -1000)
540    public void onStop(Stop event) throws InterruptedException {
541        if (closing || !serverSocketChannel.isOpen()) {
542            return;
543        }
544        newEventPipeline().fire(new Close(), this).get();
545    }

547    /**
548     * The Interface of the SocketServer MXBean.
549     */
550    public interface SocketServerMXBean {
551
552        /**
553         * The Class ChannelInfo.
554         */
555        class ChannelInfo {
556
557            private final SocketChannelImpl channel;
558
559            /**
560             * Instantiates a new channel info.
561             *
562             * @param channel the channel
563             */
564            public ChannelInfo(SocketChannelImpl channel) {
565                this.channel = channel;
566            }
567
568            /**
569             * Checks if is purgeable.
570             *
571             * @return true, if is purgeable
572             */
573            public boolean isPurgeable() {
574                return channel.isPurgeable();
575            }
576
577            /**
578             * Gets the downstream pool.
579             *
580             * @return the downstream pool
581             */
582            public String getDownstreamPool() {
583                return channel.readBuffers().name();
584            }
585
586            /**
587             * Gets the upstream pool.
588             *
589             * @return the upstream pool
590             */
591            public String getUpstreamPool() {
592                return channel.byteBufferPool().name();
593            }
594        }
595
596        /**
597         * Gets the component path.
598         *
599         * @return the component path
600         */
601        String getComponentPath();
602
603        /**
604         * Gets the channel count.
605         *
606         * @return the channel count
607         */
608        int getChannelCount();
609
610        /**
611         * Gets the channels.
612         *
613         * @return the channels
614         */
615        SortedMap<String, ChannelInfo> getChannels();
616
617    }

619    /**
620     * The Class SocketServerInfo.
621     */
622    public static class SocketServerInfo implements SocketServerMXBean {
623
624        private static MBeanServer mbs
625            = ManagementFactory.getPlatformMBeanServer();
626
627        private ObjectName mbeanName;
628        private final WeakReference<SocketServer> serverRef;
629
630        /**
631         * Instantiates a new socket server info.
632         *
633         * @param server the server
634         */
635        @SuppressWarnings({ "PMD.EmptyCatchBlock",
636            "PMD.AvoidCatchingGenericException",
637            "PMD.ConstructorCallsOverridableMethod" })
638        public SocketServerInfo(SocketServer server) {
639            serverRef = new WeakReference<>(server);
640            try {
641                String endPoint = "";
642                if (server.serverAddress instanceof InetSocketAddress) {
643                    endPoint = " (:"
644                        + ((InetSocketAddress) server.serverAddress).getPort()
645                        + ")";
646                } else if (server.serverAddress instanceof UnixDomainSocketAddress) {
647                    endPoint = " ("
648                        + ((UnixDomainSocketAddress) server.serverAddress)
649                            .getPath()
650                        + ")";
651
652                }
653                mbeanName = new ObjectName("org.jgrapes.io:type="
654                    + SocketServer.class.getSimpleName() + ",name="
655                    + ObjectName
656                        .quote(Components.objectName(server) + endPoint));
657            } catch (MalformedObjectNameException e) {
658                // Should not happen
659            }
660            try {
661                mbs.unregisterMBean(mbeanName);
662            } catch (Exception e) {
663                // Just in case, should not work
664            }
665            try {
666                mbs.registerMBean(this, mbeanName);
667            } catch (InstanceAlreadyExistsException | MBeanRegistrationException
668                    | NotCompliantMBeanException e) {
669                // Have to live with that
670            }
671        }
672
673        /**
674         * Server.
675         *
676         * @return the optional
677         */
678        @SuppressWarnings({ "PMD.AvoidCatchingGenericException",
679            "PMD.EmptyCatchBlock" })
680        public Optional<SocketServer> server() {
681            SocketServer server = serverRef.get();
682            if (server == null) {
683                try {
684                    mbs.unregisterMBean(mbeanName);
685                } catch (Exception e) {
686                    // Should work.
687                }
688            }
689            return Optional.ofNullable(server);
690        }
691
692        @Override
693        public String getComponentPath() {
694            return server().map(mgr -> mgr.componentPath()).orElse("<removed>");
695        }
696
697        @Override
698        public int getChannelCount() {
699            return server().map(server -> server.channels.size()).orElse(0);
700        }
701
702        @Override
703        @SuppressWarnings("PMD.AvoidInstantiatingObjectsInLoops")
704        public SortedMap<String, ChannelInfo> getChannels() {
705            return server().map(server -> {
706                SortedMap<String, ChannelInfo> result = new TreeMap<>();
707                for (SocketChannelImpl channel : server.channels) {
708                    result.put(channel.nioChannel().socket()
709                        .getRemoteSocketAddress().toString(),
710                        new ChannelInfo(channel));
711                }
712                return result;
713            }).orElse(Collections.emptySortedMap());
714        }
715    }

717    /**
718     * An MBean interface for getting information about the socket servers
719     * and established connections.
720     */
721    public interface SocketServerSummaryMXBean {
722
723        /**
724         * Gets the connections per server statistics.
725         *
726         * @return the connections per server statistics
727         */
728        IntSummaryStatistics getConnectionsPerServerStatistics();
729
730        /**
731         * Gets the servers.
732         *
733         * @return the servers
734         */
735        Set<SocketServerMXBean> getServers();
736    }
737
738    /**
739     * The MBeanView.
740     */
741    private static class MBeanView implements SocketServerSummaryMXBean {
742        private static Set<SocketServerInfo> serverInfos = new HashSet<>();
743
744        /**
745         * Adds the server to the reported servers.
746         *
747         * @param server the server
748         */
749        public static void addServer(SocketServer server) {
750            synchronized (serverInfos) {
751                serverInfos.add(new SocketServerInfo(server));
752            }
753        }
754
755        /**
756         * Returns the infos.
757         *
758         * @return the sets the
759         */
760        private Set<SocketServerInfo> infos() {
761            Set<SocketServerInfo> expired = new HashSet<>();
762            synchronized (serverInfos) {
763                for (SocketServerInfo serverInfo : serverInfos) {
764                    if (!serverInfo.server().isPresent()) {
765                        expired.add(serverInfo);
766                    }
767                }
768                serverInfos.removeAll(expired);
769            }
770            return serverInfos;
771        }
772
773        @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
774        @Override
775        public Set<SocketServerMXBean> getServers() {
776            return (Set<SocketServerMXBean>) (Object) infos();
777        }
778
779        @Override
780        public IntSummaryStatistics getConnectionsPerServerStatistics() {
781            return infos().stream().map(info -> info.server().get())
782                .filter(ref -> ref != null).collect(
783                    Collectors.summarizingInt(srv -> srv.channels.size()));
784        }
785    }
786
787    static {
788        try {
789            MBeanServer mbs = ManagementFactory.getPlatformMBeanServer();
790            ObjectName mxbeanName = new ObjectName("org.jgrapes.io:type="
791                + SocketServer.class.getSimpleName() + "s");
792            mbs.registerMBean(new MBeanView(), mxbeanName);
793        } catch (MalformedObjectNameException | InstanceAlreadyExistsException
794                | MBeanRegistrationException | NotCompliantMBeanException e) {
795            // Does not happen
796        }
797    }
798
799}
